1: %% @doc Property-based tests for router_policy_store
    2: %% Uses PropEr for randomized sequence of operations to detect race conditions
    3: -module(router_policy_store_prop_SUITE).
    4: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    5: 
    6: %% Check if PropEr is available
    7: -ifdef(TEST).
    8: -define(HAVE_PROPER, code:which(proper) =/= non_existing).
    9: -else.
   10: -define(HAVE_PROPER, false).
   11: -endif.
   12: 
   13: -ifdef(HAVE_PROPER).
   14: -include_lib("proper/include/proper.hrl").
   15: -endif.
   16: 
   17: -compile(export_all).
   18: 
   19: -export([all/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   20: 
   21: -include("beamline_router.hrl").
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [
   25:         prop_concurrent_operations,
   26:         prop_upsert_delete_consistency,
   27:         prop_list_policies_ordering,
   28:         prop_index_consistency
   29:     ].
   30: 
   31: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   32:     %% Start application with ephemeral port
   33:     _ = application:load(beamline_router),
   34:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_port, 0),
   35:     %% Disable heir/transfer logic for faster test execution
   36:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, disable_heir, true),
   37:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, grpc_enabled, false),
   38:     ok = application:set_env(beamline_router, nats_mode, mock),
   39:     case application:ensure_all_started(beamline_router) of
   40:         {ok, _} ->
   41:             Config;
   42:         Error ->
   43:             ct:fail("Failed to start beamline_router: ~p", [Error])
   44:     end.
   45: 
   46: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   47:     application:stop(beamline_router),
   48:     ok.
   49: 
   50: %% Property: Concurrent operations maintain consistency
   51: prop_concurrent_operations(_Config) ->
   52:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   53:         false ->
   54:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   55:         true ->
   56:             Prop = ?FORALL(
   57:                 Operations,
   58:                 list(operation()),
   59:                 begin
   60:                     TenantId = <<"prop_tenant">>,
   61:                     %% Execute operations sequentially (gen_server serializes)
   62:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
   63:                     
   64:                     %% Verify final state is consistent
   65:                     {ok, FinalPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
   66:                     
   67:                     %% Check: all policies in list should be valid
   68:                     AllValid = lists:all(fun(P) ->
   69:                         is_record(P, policy) andalso
   70:                         P#policy.tenant_id =:= TenantId
   71:                     end, FinalPolicies),
   72:                     
   73:                     %% Check: no duplicate policy_ids
   74:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- FinalPolicies],
   75:                     NoDuplicates = length(PolicyIds) =:= length(lists:usort(PolicyIds)),
   76:                     
   77:                     AllValid andalso NoDuplicates
   78:                 end
   79:             ),
   80:             Result = proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]),
   81:             case Result of
   82:                 true -> 
   83:                     ok;
   84:                 false ->
   85:                     ct:fail("Property failed");
   86:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
   87:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample]);
   88:                 Other ->
   89:                     ct:fail("Unexpected result from proper:quickcheck: ~p", [Other])
   90:             end
   91:     end.
   92: 
   93: %% Property: Upsert and delete maintain consistency
   94: prop_upsert_delete_consistency(_Config) ->
   95:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
   96:         false ->
   97:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
   98:         true ->
   99:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  100:                 {Upserts, Deletes},
  101:                 {list(upsert_operation()), list(delete_operation())},
  102:                 begin
  103:                     TenantId = <<"prop_consistency_tenant">>,
  104:                     
  105:                     %% Execute all upserts
  106:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Upserts],
  107:                     
  108:                     %% Execute all deletes
  109:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Deletes],
  110:                     
  111:                     %% Verify: deleted policies should not be in list
  112:                     {ok, Policies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  113:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Policies],
  114:                     
  115:                     %% Get deleted policy IDs
  116:                     DeletedIds = [PolicyId || {delete, PolicyId} <- Deletes],
  117:                     
  118:                     %% Check: no deleted policy should be in final list
  119:                     lists:all(fun(DeletedId) ->
  120:                         not lists:member(DeletedId, PolicyIds)
  121:                     end, DeletedIds)
  122:                 end
  123:             ),
  124:             Result = proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]),
  125:             case Result of
  126:                 true -> 
  127:                     ok;
  128:                 false ->
  129:                     ct:fail("Property failed");
  130:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  131:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample]);
  132:                 Other ->
  133:                     ct:fail("Unexpected result from proper:quickcheck: ~p", [Other])
  134:             end
  135:     end.
  136: 
  137: %% Property: list_policies always returns sorted results
  138: prop_list_policies_ordering(_Config) ->
  139:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  140:         false ->
  141:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  142:         true ->
  143:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  144:                 Policies,
  145:                 list(policy()),
  146:                 begin
  147:                     TenantId = <<"prop_ordering_tenant">>,
  148:                     
  149:                     %% Clear existing policies
  150:                     {ok, Existing} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  151:                     [router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, P#policy.policy_id) || P <- Existing],
  152:                     
  153:                     %% Insert all policies
  154:                     [router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, P) || P <- Policies],
  155:                     
  156:                     %% Get list
  157:                     {ok, Listed} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  158:                     
  159:                     %% Check: results are sorted by policy_id (lexicographic binary order)
  160:                     PolicyIds = [P#policy.policy_id || P <- Listed],
  161:                     %% Use Erlang term ordering (<) to match implementation
  162:                     Sorted = lists:sort(PolicyIds),
  163:                     
  164:                     PolicyIds =:= Sorted
  165:                 end
  166:             ),
  167:             Result = proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]),
  168:             case Result of
  169:                 true -> 
  170:                     ok;
  171:                 false ->
  172:                     ct:fail("Property failed");
  173:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  174:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample]);
  175:                 Other ->
  176:                     ct:fail("Unexpected result from proper:quickcheck: ~p", [Other])
  177:             end
  178:     end.
  179: 
  180: %% Property: Secondary index maintains consistency with main table
  181: prop_index_consistency(_Config) ->
  182:     case ?HAVE_PROPER of
  183:         false ->
  184:             {skip, "PropEr not available"};
  185:         true ->
  186:             Prop = ?FORALL(
  187:                 Operations,
  188:                 list(operation()),
  189:                 begin
  190:                     TenantId = <<"prop_index_tenant">>,
  191:                     
  192:                     %% Execute operations
  193:                     [execute_operation(TenantId, Op) || Op <- Operations],
  194:                     
  195:                     %% Get policies via list_policies (uses index)
  196:                     {ok, IndexedPolicies} = router_policy_store:list_policies(TenantId),
  197:                     IndexedIds = lists:sort([P#policy.policy_id || P <- IndexedPolicies]),
  198:                     
  199:                     %% Get policies via direct lookup (bypasses index)
  200:                     AllKeys = ets:match(policy_store, {{TenantId, '$1'}, '_'}),
  201:                     DirectIds = lists:sort([Id || [Id] <- AllKeys]),
  202:                     
  203:                     %% Check: index and direct lookup should match
  204:                     IndexConsistent = IndexedIds =:= DirectIds,
  205:                     
  206:                     %% Check: for each {TenantId, PolicyId} in main table, there's exactly one entry in index
  207:                     IndexTable = policy_store_index,
  208:                     AllIndexEntries = ets:match_object(IndexTable, {TenantId, '_'}),
  209:                     IndexPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {_TenantId, PolicyId} <- AllIndexEntries]),
  210:                     
  211:                     %% Check: all policies in main table have corresponding index entries
  212:                     AllMainPolicies = ets:match_object(policy_store, {{TenantId, '_'}, '_'}),
  213:                     MainPolicyIds = lists:sort([PolicyId || {{_TenantId, PolicyId}, _Policy} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  214:                     
  215:                     IndexComplete = MainPolicyIds =:= IndexPolicyIds,
  216:                     
  217:                     %% Check: bag index invariants
  218:                     %% 1. Each {TenantId, PolicyId} pair appears exactly once in index
  219:                     %% Bag allows multiple entries per key, but each {tenant_id, policy_id} pair should be unique
  220:                     IndexPairs = [{T, P} || {T, P} <- AllIndexEntries],
  221:                     UniquePairs = lists:usort(IndexPairs),
  222:                     NoDuplicates = length(IndexPairs) =:= length(UniquePairs),
  223:                     
  224:                     %% 2. For each policy in main table, there's exactly one index entry
  225:                     OneToOne = length(MainPolicyIds) =:= length(IndexPolicyIds),
  226:                     
  227:                     %% 3. Bag index deletion uses delete_object (not delete)
  228:                     %% This ensures that only specific {tenant_id, policy_id} pairs are removed,
  229:                     %% not all entries for a tenant_id
  230:                     %% Verification: index should only contain pairs that exist in main table
  231:                     IndexPairsSet = sets:from_list(IndexPairs),
  232:                     MainPairsSet = sets:from_list([{TenantId, PolicyId} || {{_T, PolicyId}, _} <- AllMainPolicies]),
  233:                     IndexMatchesMain = sets:is_equal(IndexPairsSet, MainPairsSet),
  234:                     
  235:                     %% All checks must pass
  236:                     IndexConsistent andalso IndexComplete andalso NoDuplicates andalso OneToOne andalso IndexMatchesMain
  237:                 end
  238:             ),
  239:             Result = proper:quickcheck(Prop, [{numtests, 100}]),
  240:             case Result of
  241:                 true -> 
  242:                     ok;
  243:                 false ->
  244:                     ct:fail("Property failed");
  245:                 {false, CounterExample} ->
  246:                     ct:fail("Property failed with counterexample: ~p", [CounterExample]);
  247:                 Other ->
  248:                     ct:fail("Unexpected result from proper:quickcheck: ~p", [Other])
  249:             end
  250:     end.
  251: 
  252: %% Generators
  253: 
  254: operation() ->
  255:     oneof([
  256:         upsert_operation(),
  257:         delete_operation()
  258:     ]).
  259: 
  260: upsert_operation() ->
  261:     ?LET(
  262:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  263:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  264:         {upsert, #policy{
  265:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  266:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  267:             weights = Weights,
  268:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  269:             defaults = #{},
  270:             escalate_on = [],
  271:             fallback = undefined,
  272:             sticky = undefined,
  273:             metadata = #{}
  274:         }}
  275:     ).
  276: 
  277: delete_operation() ->
  278:     ?LET(
  279:         PolicyId,
  280:         policy_id(),
  281:         {delete, PolicyId}
  282:     ).
  283: 
  284: policy() ->
  285:     ?LET(
  286:         {PolicyId, Weights},
  287:         {policy_id(), weights()},
  288:         #policy{
  289:             tenant_id = <<"prop_tenant">>,
  290:             policy_id = PolicyId,
  291:             weights = Weights,
  292:             version = <<"1.0">>,
  293:             defaults = #{},
  294:             escalate_on = [],
  295:             fallback = undefined,
  296:             sticky = undefined,
  297:             metadata = #{}
  298:         }
  299:     ).
  300: 
  301: policy_id() ->
  302:     ?LET(
  303:         N,
  304:         integer(1, 1000),
  305:         list_to_binary("policy_" ++ integer_to_list(N))
  306:     ).
  307: 
  308: weights() ->
  309:     ?LET(
  310:         Providers,
  311:         list({provider_id(), weight()}),
  312:         maps:from_list(Providers)
  313:     ).
  314: 
  315: provider_id() ->
  316:     oneof([<<"openai">>, <<"anthropic">>, <<"cohere">>]).
  317: 
  318: weight() ->
  319:     ?LET(
  320:         W,
  321:         real(),
  322:         max(0.0, min(1.0, abs(W)))
  323:     ).
  324: 
  325: %% Helpers
  326: 
  327: execute_operation(TenantId, {upsert, Policy}) ->
  328:     router_policy_store:upsert_policy(TenantId, Policy);
  329: execute_operation(TenantId, {delete, PolicyId}) ->
  330:     router_policy_store:delete_policy(TenantId, PolicyId).
  331:
